Text: How much do you agree with the following statements?
Scientific evidence points to a warming trend in global climate.
Human activity is responsible for the continuing rise in average global temperature.
Humans have very little effect on climate change.
An increase in carbon dioxide levels (for example through burning fossil fuels or deforestation) is directly related to an increase in global temperature.
Humans are severely abusing the environment.
Animals have as much right to exist as humans do.
When humans interfere with nature it often has disastrous implications.
Unlike what most scientists say, there will be some positive implications of global warming for the environment.
The impact of global warming will be harmful for the environment.
Global warming will bring about some serious negative consequences.
The consequences of global warming will be more positive than negative overall.
There are limited global resources.
As an individual, I must do what I can to prevent climate change.
Buisness and industry is contributing to climate change through their emissions.
Burning of fossil fuels for transport contributes to climate change, therefore reducing fuel consumption is good for the environment.
Reducing energy consumption by using energy saving lightbulbs (as well as other energy saving devises and methods) is bad for the environment.
Reducing energy consumption (heating, electricity etc.) is good for the environment.
Using renewable energy sources is good for the environment.
Taking fewer flights and/or offsetting your flights is good for the environment.
Saving water is good for the environment.
Avoiding products with packaging is better for the environment than using packaged products.
Buying items with no packaging is good for the environment.
Buying products made of recycled materials is good for the environment.
Buying products made of sustainable, natural or biodegradable materials is good for the environment.
Recycling is good for the environment.
Composting food waste (for example at home) is better for the environment than putting it in landfills.
Reusing household items is good for the environment (Such as repurposing waste items or fixing damaged items).
Purchasing second hand goods like furniture, clothing and other household items and appliances helps reduce waste.
It's good for the environment to use reusable products rather than single use products (such as mugs, cutlery, water bottles and bags).
Products with toxic chemicals are bad for the environment (for example; toiletries, cosmetics, aerosols).
Home grown or locally grown/farmed food is good for  the environment.
Produce that is in season (grown and sold when harvested at its peak time) is good for the environment.
It's important to make sure to dispose of your recycling and waste when you're out of the house responsibly.

Sustainably disposing of waste that is unable to be recycled is important for the environment (for example; using terracycling, where one sends away such waste products to a waste management company).
It's good to buy fair trade and sustainably sourced food.
Donating and selling clothes and furniture is good for the environment (rather than disposing of them).
Wasting food is bad for the environment.
Eating less animal products (i.e dairy, poultry, fish etc.) is good for the environment.
Eating sustainably sourced animal products (i.e sustainably sourced dairy, poultry, fish etc.) is good for the environment.
Organic products (for example; food, toiletries, cosmetics) are better for the environment.
Purchasing goods and products from smaller local or independent businesses rather than large corperations is good for the environment.
How anxious do you feel about the issues above?
